title: Comparison/Logical Operators (==, !=, <, <=, >, >=, <=>, &&, ||, !)
description: Complete specification for comparison and logical operators, including the spaceship operator (<=>), short-circuit evaluation, and TBB ERR handling.

comparison_semantics: What equality semantics exist (value vs reference)?
How does comparison work on composite types (obj, struct)?
How does comparison handle TBB ERR (ERR == ERR → true)?
What derived operators exist (>= from < and ==)?
spaceship_operator: What is <=> return type (ordering enum: less/equal/greater)?
How does <=> integrate with sorting algorithms?
logical_operators: How do && and || differ from & and |?
What truthiness rules apply (0, NULL, ERR → false)?
How does ! (logical not) work on TBB ERR?
tbb_integration: How do comparisons propagate ERR (ERR < X → ERR)?
What logical operator ERR semantics (ERR && true → ERR)?
How does short-circuit interact with ERR (false && ERR → false)?
